# Critics' Choice Super Award for Best Actress in a Horror Movie

(2)
| year = 2021
| website = http://www.criticschoice.com/
}}
The '''Critics' Choice Super Award for Best Actress in a Horror Movie' is an award presented by the Critics Choice Association to the best performance by an actress in a horror film.
This award was first presented in 2021 to Elisabeth Moss for her role as Cecilia Kass in The Invisible Man. The most nominated actresses in this category are Mia Goth and Rebecca Hall with 2 nominations.
The current recipient of the award is Demi Moore for her role as Elisabeth Sparkle in The Substance.
